question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinerElectionVotingItemId()] [State Validation] Can State.MinerElectionVotingItemId.Value return null/empty Hash causing downstream voting operations to fail or reference invalid voting items? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetMinerElectionVotingItemId()] [State Manipulation] Can an attacker query this before proper initialization, causing dependent contracts to use uninitialized voting item IDs for election operations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidates()] [State Consistency] Does returning State.Candidates.Value ?? new PubkeyList() mask initialization failures where candidates should exist but State returns null? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidates()] [Data Integrity] Can State.Candidates.Value contain duplicate pubkeys due to improper add logic elsewhere, causing vote counting inconsistencies? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetCandidates()] [DOS] Can State.Candidates.Value grow unboundedly causing this view method to exceed gas limits when returning large candidate lists? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedCandidates()] [Logic Error] Does checking only State.CandidateVotes[pubkey.ToHex()].ObtainedActiveVotedVotesAmount > 0 miss candidates with withdrawn votes who should still be considered 'voted'? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedCandidates()] [State Inconsistency] Can State.CandidateVotes[pubkey.ToHex()] be null while the candidate exists in State.Candidates.Value causing candidates to be incorrectly excluded? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedCandidates()] [Integer Overflow] Can ObtainedActiveVotedVotesAmount overflow to negative values appearing as non-voted when actually having maximum votes? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedCandidates()] [DOS] If State.Candidates.Value contains thousands of entries, does iterating through all candidates and checking each candidateVotes cause excessive gas consumption? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVotedCandidates()] [Data Inconsistency] Can candidateVotes.ObtainedActiveVotedVotesAmount be manipulated to exactly 0 after receiving votes, making active candidates invisible in this view? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories()] [Cross-Contract Risk] Does lazy initialization of State.AEDPoSContract.Value at lines 43-45 create race conditions if consensus contract address changes during execution? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories()] [External Call] Can State.AEDPoSContract.GetCurrentMinerList.Call fail or return stale miner data causing victory calculation based on outdated consensus state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories()] [Data Validation] Does GetCurrentMinerList.Call().Pubkeys guarantee non-empty results, or can empty miner lists cause GetVictories(currentMiners) to behave unexpectedly? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories()] [Encoding Risk] Can .ToHex() conversion at line 48 produce different hex strings for same pubkey bytes causing miner matching failures in GetVictories()? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories(List<string>)] [Logic Error] At line 60, does State.MinersCount.Value - validCandidates.Count overflow when validCandidates.Count exceeds MinersCount due to unchecked state updates? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories(List<string>)] [Backup Miners Logic] Can the backup selection at lines 66-74 include banned miners from currentMiners.Where(k => !validCandidates.Contains(k)) since banned status isn't checked? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories(List<string>)] [Initial Miners Injection] Does adding State.InitialMiners at lines 67-69 without checking if they're already in backups create duplicate entries in victories list? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Election/ViewMethods.cs] [Function: GetVictories(List<string>)] [Determinism] Does backups.OrderBy(p => p) at line 71 produce consistent ordering across nodes with different string comparison implementations? (Medium)
